How to get a dragon
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 1 Archive (PSOne): Monsters: Dragon: How to get a dragon
By MaJoBeRiDiOmEn! on Friday, May 12, 2000 - 11:51 pm:

Ever wonder whether you can breed such a legendary monster? well then, test your monster ranching skills and breed that dragon!

dragon's are hard to get, i have to say. first of all, you must have a monster in B-class that can beat A-class with ease (in short, a super-monster in B-class). work your way to the month of April, until you see the B-class Trial Cup tournament at the 4th week. join in (if you're confident enough), beat the 2 worms and the trial cup dragon, and afterwards, fight and win in the oficials in the 4th week of june to elevate your monster's rank to A-class. you will then get an invitation to a special 1-on-1 tourney somewhere in august, where you will fight a Laguna (dragon/monol) named Megiras. Win, and you will get a dragon tusk. Afterwards, combine a Grape(dino/naga) and a Stinger (naga/dino) with the dragon tusk, and you will get a purebred dragon.

Warning: Dragons have pretty short lifespans.

By torey_luvullo on Sunday, May 14, 2000 - 01:45 pm:

btw, the good thing about dragons, unlike magics, is that the stats of the stinger and grape carry over very well into the new dragon. so it is well worth your while to train up your grape and stinger before combining.

By Nate Railsback on Monday, May 15, 2000 - 12:43 am:

Is it just me, or did Dragons looks cooler in MR1 than in MR2? I mean, in MR2 all of the enemy Dragons look like babies still (I haven't raised one myself yet). In MR1, they developed these awesome horns in later life, and the Techno Dragon definately looked better back then.
